TEXT: CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings in the ORG of the LOC ( “ the ORG ” ) against the GPE ORG ( “ the police office ” ) and ORG . She challenged their actions in investigating the criminal case against PERSON , who had inflicted light bodily harm on the applicant in DATE . The applicant also claimed compensation for the damage caused to her .
CARDINAL . DATE and DATE no hearings were held since the judge sitting in the case was on holiday .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG left the applicant 's claim without consideration since she failed to appear . On DATE the ORG reviewed its decision and the proceedings were resumed .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG partly allowed the claim and awarded the applicant ORG CARDINAL,CARDINAL ( about EUR CARDINAL,CARDINAL ) in compensation for non - pecuniary damage , to be paid by the police office .
CARDINAL . The applicant and the police office lodged their appeals against the judgment .
CARDINAL . On DATE and DATE ORG left the applicant 's and the police office 's appeals , respectively , without consideration due to their procedural shortcomings .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG of GPE ( “ the Court of Appeal ” ) dismissed the applicant 's appeal against the ruling of DATE . On DATE the applicant lodged an appeal in cassation against the ruling of CARDINAL DATE with ORG .
CARDINAL . There was no procedural activity from DATE to CARDINAL DATE .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG transferred the case to ORG for consideration . On DATE the latter , acting in its cassation jurisdiction , quashed the ruling of CARDINAL DATE and transmitted the case to ORG for consideration of the applicant 's appeal against the ruling of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG quashed the ruling of DATE . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment of DATE and terminated the proceedings since the first instance court had no jurisdiction to consider the case .

CARDINAL . The applicant stated in her submissions that she had challenged the decision of DATE before ORG and the proceedings are still pending . However , she provided no documents in support of that statement . According to the records provided by the Government , the applicant lodged no appeal against the decision of DATE .

CARDINAL . In the period from DATE till DATE the applicant 's apartment was used by the acquaintances of her son , PERSON , who moved in without her permission and , according to the applicant 's submissions , damaged it .

CARDINAL . On DATE the applicant instituted proceedings in the ORG against Mr B. and Mr S. seeking compensation for pecuniary and non - pecuniary damage . On an unspecified date the case was transferred to ORG . On DATE the latter left the applicant 's claim without consideration . On DATE ORG of the Crimean Region quashed that ruling .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG left the applicant 's claim without consideration and discontinued the proceedings .

CARDINAL . On DATE the ORG of ORG of GPE allowed the protest ( extraordinary appeal ) of its Deputy President against the ruling of CARDINAL DATE , quashed it and remitted the case to ORG for fresh consideration .

CARDINAL . On DATE ORG partly allowed the applicant 's claims and awarded her CARDINAL NORP hryvnias ( ORG ) , to be paid by PERSON B. and UAH CARDINAL,CARDINAL , to be paid by PERSON The judgment was not appealed against and became final . It remained unenforced .

CARDINAL . NORP In DATE Mr B. asked ORG to renew a deadline to appeal against the judgment of CARDINAL DATE . On DATE ORG granted his request . On DATE ORG quashed the judgment of DATE and remitted the case to ORG . In particular , ORG found that PERSON had not been duly informed about the hearings in the case and that the judgment of CARDINAL DATE had been adopted in his absence .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed the applicant 's appeal in cassation against the ruling of DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG partly allowed the applicant 's claims and awarded her UAH CARDINAL ( CARDINAL , ORG ) , to be paid jointly by PERSON and PERSON
CARDINAL . On DATE ORG dismissed PERSON appeal due to its procedural shortcomings .
